briefdescription.para: BeginScene() must be called before calling drawing functions.
EndScene() must be called to flush the drawing buffer and display the scene.
Flushes scene to window. Normally called by EndScene().
Plot a point in the Graphics window.

parameterdescription.para: Color index, as defined in colormap file "default.ctb", which should be in the same directory as the executable.
Coordinate of point, in Graphics coordinates (typically twice as large as the cellular automata coordinates).

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int colour)
memberdef.name: Line

briefdescription.para: Plots a field of values given by **f, using color coding given by colormap file.

detaileddescription.para: Only implemented in X11Graphics. No checks. Usage not recommended.

parameterdescription.para: Double pointer to array of integers, giving color indices using standard colormap ('default.ctb').

briefdescription.para: Probes the Window for user interaction, with mouse or keyboard.

detaileddescription.para: This function should return immediately, and return 0 if there was no user interaction.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer where the clicked coordinate will be stored.

briefdescription.para: Changes the title bar of the Graphics window.

parameterdescription.para: Text to display in title bar.

briefdescription.para: Recovers the title prior to the last call of ChangeTitle().
Returns the upper left and lower right coordinates of the area occupied by cells.

detaileddescription.para:
Bounding box as a LineType structure {int x1,int y1,int x2,int y2}.
Warning: Assumes the window only displays cells (i.e. no PDE fields etc.). If you need this, better implement it as a member function of class CellularPotts.

briefdescription.para: This member function was part of functionality that enables interactive resizing of the Window and CPM field, and followed by interactive replacement of the Dish's contents. The current version of CPM does not contain such functionality.
Returns the width of the Graphics window, in pixels.
Returns the height of the Graphics window, in pixels.
Writes the Image to a file.

detaileddescription.para: File format is inferred from file extension. Currently only PNG is supported by the X-Windows implementation; the Qt-implentation supports all formats supported by Qt.

parameterdescription.para: File name with standard image file extension (e.g. png).
Quality of JPEG images, defaults to -1 (no value provided).

briefdescription.para: Clears all pixels in the Image.
Implement this member function in your simulation code.

detaileddescription.para: Include all actions that should be carried out during a simulation step, including PDE and CPM simulation steps. See the included examples (vessel.cpp, sorting.cpp) for more information.

briefdescription.para: X-Windows implementation of Graphics interface. For API see documentation of base class Graphics. Has a number extra features: see below.
